activation of NF-kappaB (p65/p50) is crucial for the TNFalpha-induced stimulation of IL-17C expression in human keratinocytes
IL-17C is an essential autocrine cytokine that regulates innate epithelial immune responses.
In our pilot study, we discovered significant changes in methylation patterns of genes IL-7, IL-13, IL-17C and TYK2 between henodialysis patients and healthy subjects

Data suggest that activation of TLR5 upregulates IL17C expression in cells from intestinal mucosa and colonic adenocarcinoma; IL17C expression is upregulated in intestinal mucosa cells from patients with ulcerative colitis compared with normal cells.
IL-17C is involved in the innate immune response of respiratory epithelial cells and is suppressed by cigarette smoke.
Keratinocyte overexpression of IL-17C promotes psoriasiform skin inflammation.
Interleukin-17C is present in the tissue around aseptic loosened implants.
Our study provides evidence that Staphylococcus aureus activates NOD2 in keratinocytes, resulting in an increased expression of IL-17C, a mechanism that may be dysregulated in atopic dermatitis.
IL-17C is an essential epithelial cell-derived cytokine.
Those carrying rs3748067 CC genotype and C allele had a significantly increased risk for the development of gastric cancer
CpG methylation is reduced in gingival biopsies of patients with periodontitis

Inflammatory cell expression of IL-9 and IL-17C were increased in chronic rhinosinusitis, particularly with allergy and asthma. These interleukins may contribute to the pathogenesis of chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps as well as atopy and may serve as therapeutic targets for disease management

Data indicate that epithelial IL-17C promotes neutrophilic inflammation in the tumor microenvironment and suggest that IL-17C links a pathologic microbiota, as present in COPD patients, with enhanced tumor growth.

Helicobacter pylori infection was associated with a significant increase in IL-17C expression in gastric mucosa. The role of IL-17C in the pathogenesis of H. pylori-induced diseases remains to be determined.

Study utilizing human skin samples, cultured primary human and mouse keratinocytes, and mouse disease models indicates that IL-17C is a central mediator of skin inflammation beyond psoriasis and is relevant in particular in atopic dermatitis.
Patients with acute Anti-neutrophil cytoplasmatic antibody (ANCA)-associated crescentic glomerulonephritis (GN) had significantly elevated serum levels of IL-17C.
IL-17C-mediated innate inflammation decreases the response to PD-1 blockade in a model of Kras-driven lung cancer.
IL-17C/IL-17RE: Emergence of a Unique Axis in TH17 Biology.
Rhinovirus Induces Basolateral Release of IL-17C in Highly Differentiated Airway Epithelial Cells.
IL-17C expression and its correlation with pediatric adenoids: a preliminary study.
IL-17C contributes to NTHi-induced inflammation and lung damage in experimental COPD and is present in sputum during acute exacerbations.
Asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 Infection Is Associated With Higher Levels of Serum IL-17C, Matrix Metalloproteinase 10 and Fibroblast Growth Factors Than Mild Symptomatic COVID-19.
Th17-Derived Cytokines Synergistically Enhance IL-17C Production by the Colonic Epithelium.
IL-17C neutralization protects the kidney against acute injury and chronic injury.
IL-17C is a driver of damaging inflammation during Neisseria gonorrhoeae infection of human Fallopian tube.

name: interleukin 17C
summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a T cell-derived cytokine that shares the sequence similarity with IL17. This cytokine was reported to stimulate the release of tumor necrosis factor alpha and interleukin 1 beta from a monocytic cell line. The expression of this cytokine was found to be restricted to activated T cells. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
